DataElement.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma Negative Surgical Margin Closest Neoplasm Present NCI Concept Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicates the degree of invasiveness of neoplasm closest to the negative margin in a cutaneous melanoma specimen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.:definition pending

Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.
Indicates the absence of tumor cells at the edge of a surgically excised specimen.

Property.preferredDefinition: Indicating the one of several that is the shortest distance away.:An abnormal tissue growth resulted from uncontrolled cell proliferation.  Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant ones exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic

Concepts.definition: Indicating the one of several that is the shortest distance away.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma Negative Surgical Margin Closest Neoplasm Present NCI Concept Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicates what neoplasm is closest to the margin._A concept unique identifier within the NCI Enterprise Vocabulary Service's NCI Thesaurus.

Concepts.definition: A melanoma of the skin that is not confined to the dermal-epidermal junction, and has infiltrated the dermis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A melanoma of the skin characterized by the presence of melanoma cells in the dermal-epidermal junction only, without infiltration of the papillary or reticular dermis.

Concepts.longName: Stage 0 Cutaneous Melanoma AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0.  Tis: Melanoma in situ.  N0: No regional lymph node metastases.  M0: No detectable evidence of distant metastases. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)
